intro: Combesia muscosa, commonly known as the mossy combesia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. It features small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white in color. Its foliage is dense and moss-like, contributing to its common name.
